info.game_comments: Battle of the Decades: The 2000s game 3.

(1, 1).clue: The 2000 Toy of the Year was a scooter from this brand whose logo is seen here

(2, 1).clue: This New York spot became popular after Napoleon's brother Jerome & his American bride honeymooned there in 1804

(3, 1).clue: You might think we're crazy to play the song of this bird

(4, 1).clue: Britannica says the human digestive system begins at these fleshy bits; mum's the word on where it ends

(5, 1).clue: He called his role in "Leaving Las Vegas" the "portrayal of a dead man's suicide letter"

(6, 1).clue: Completes the Founding Fathers' phrase "We hold these truths to be..."

(1, 2).clue: News Corporation paid $580 million in 2005 to get this social networking site that sold for $35 million in 2011

(2, 2).clue: Vistas of Pennsylvania seen from Blue Mountain & Lehigh Gap are highlights of this 2,000-mile hiking trail

(3, 2).clue: It's the common urban dweller heard here

(4, 2).clue: This shortest, initial part of the small intestine has ducts from the pancreas & gall bladder

(5, 2).clue: As he's passing out, a drunk Jonah Hill headbutts Emma Stone in this 2007 comedy

(6, 2).clue: Status in common of freelance writers, sole business proprietors & contract killers

(1, 3).clue: New word for a hairstyle that copies a "Taxi Driver" look but without shaving the sides

(2, 3).clue: The red sandstone buttes of this Arizona/Utah valley continue to inspire

(3, 3).clue: The wing noise tells you it's this bird

(5, 3).clue: Bartender Howard Da Silva finally cuts off Ray Milland early in this film

(6, 3).clue: The Offspring sang, "I know she's playing with me, that's okay cause I got no" this

(2, 4).clue: Drop anchor & relax on this northern Arizona lake created by Glen Canyon Dam

(4, 4).clue: A main function of the large intestine is the absorption of these current-conducting compounds

(5, 4).clue: The Scopes Trial judge was "prejudential", explains a sloshed narrator in this Comedy Central series

(1, 5).clue: Bill Wasik came up with the idea for these; the first to succeed, in June 2003, gathered 200 folks at a Macy's rug department

(6, 5).clue: This adjective is a synonym for "modest"; literally, it would mean erasing one's own person

(1, 1).clue: This Nobel Prize-winning nun was featured on a 2010 stamp

(2, 1).clue: Carrie Underwood starred in a 2013 live TV presentation of this musical

(3, 1).clue: The Pindus range on the border of Thessaly & Epirus is often called the "Spine of" this country

(4, 1).clue: (Alex reports from the J. Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles.)  In his series paintings, this artist concentrated on a single subject to show how the light changes depending on the time of day & the season; here is one of his 30 "Wheatstacks," in this case, on a winter morning

(5, 1).clue: Completes the title of Robert Pirsig's road saga "Zen and the Art of..."

(6, 1).clue: Adjective for handwriting that can be read

(2, 2).clue: It's a wild world for this convert to the Muslim faith, a 2014 inductee into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame

(3, 2).clue: Algeria's Aures Mountains are at the eastern end of this mountain system

(5, 2).clue: Tom Wolfe's "From" this "to Our House" cleverly rhymes a Gropius creation

(6, 2).clue: Getting one for the chalkboard? Don't skimp, go all-felt

(3, 3).clue: Turner Ward Knob in Arkansas' Boston Mountains is the highest named peak in this much larger range

(5, 3).clue: The title of this 1943 bestseller refers to an Ailanthus

(6, 3).clue: Ruminant adjective for a bashful grin

(0, 0).clue: In 2005 the Kul Sharif Mosque of Tatarstan was reopened 453 years after it was destroyed by this man
